title: Syncing Intermittently Stopped after the merge
body:
erigon version: 2022.09.1-alpha
prysm: 3.1.1
script:
```
./bin/erigon \
        --datadir=./data \
        --chain=mainnet \
        --http.addr=0.0.0.0 \
        --http.port=8545 \
        --http.corsdomain=* \
        --http.vhosts=* \
        --http.api=eth,net,trace,web3,erigon \
        --ws \
        --authrpc.jwtsecret=/home/ubuntu/erigon/execution/data/jwt.hex
```

logs:
```
[INFO] [09-16|05:31:39.220] [1/15 Headers] Waiting for Beacon Chain...
[INFO] [09-16|05:31:39.220] [1/15 Headers] Fork choice missing header with hash e1f88665bdcc6fd72b7e4ef9c683206795e8c324235eb494dce5ba851fcc0b53

```

When I restarted after the problem occur, synchronization works normally again.

Same for me, it started to happen around 22:00 UTC

Consensus layer is teku 22.9.0 in my case

+1 here also with same Erigon / Prysm versions, it seems the client can eventually start syncing up after restart sometimes (we run 6 nodes on same config and it randomly works and not after restarting). We run sepolia and goerli on the similar config without issues...
same for me with prysm v3.1.1 and erigon v2022.09.01
+1. Restarts don't seem to fix the issue on the three nodes we are running at v2022.09.01, Prysm 3.1.1

It happened again at around 19:32 (UTC+2).
Here are the relevant logs:
